block.p: Denyse Duval Thors and William James Pugsley were married yesterday at St. John's Episcopal Church in Cold Spring Harbor, N.Y. The Rev. Churchill G. Pinder performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Pugsley, who is known professionally as Denyse Duval, is a jewelry designer and consultant in Cold Spring Harbor. She is the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Frederick W. Duval. Her father was a founder of The Park Avenue Social Review and the Park Avenue Association. Her mother, Sally E. Duval, was the founder of Duval Catering in Greenwich, Conn.
Denyse Duval Thors and William James Pugsley were married yesterday at St. John's Episcopal Church in Cold Spring Harbor, N.Y. The Rev. Churchill G. Pinder performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Pugsley, who is known professionally as Denyse Duval, is a jewelry designer and consultant in Cold Spring Harbor. She is the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Frederick W. Duval. Her father was a founder of The Park Avenue Social Review and the Park Avenue Association. Her mother, Sally E. Duval, was the founder of Duval Catering in Greenwich, Conn.

Mr. Pugsley retired from the County Council in Nottinghamshire, England. He graduated from Nottingham University. He is a son of the late Ada and William Pugsley. His father was a baker in Nottingham.
The bride, who was divorced, and the bridegroom, a widower, met in 1998 on a helicopter hiking trip in the Bugaboos, part of the Purcell Mountains in British Columbia.
